text: Evidence for distinct intracellular signaling pathways in <extra_id_0> CD34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + progenitor to dendritic cell differentiation from a human cell line model .
Intracellular signals that mediate differentiation of pluripotent hemopoietic progenitors to dendritic cells ( DC ) are largely undefined .

We have previously shown that protein kinase C ( PKC ) activation ( with phorbol ester ( PMA ) alone ) specifically induces differentiation of primary human <extra_id_0> CD34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + hemopoietic progenitor cells ( HPC ) to mature DC .

We now find that cytokine - driven ( granulocyte-macrophage CSF and <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) <extra_id_0> CD34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + HPC -- > DC differentiation is preferentially blocked by inhibitors of PKC activation .

To further identify intracellular signals and downstream events important in <extra_id_0> CD34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + HPC -- > DC differentiation we have characterized a human leukemic cell line model of this process .

The <extra_id_0> CD34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + myelomonocytic cell line KG1 differentiates into dendritic-like cells in response to <extra_id_0> granulocyte-macrophage CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plus <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , or PMA ( with or without the calcium ionophore ionomycin , or <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , with different stimuli mediating different aspects of the process .

Phenotypic DC characteristics of KG1 dendritic-like cells include morphology ( loosely adherent cells with long neurite processes ) , MHC I+ / MHC IIbright / <extra_id_0> CD83 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / <extra_id_0> CD86 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - surface Ag expression , and <extra_id_0> RelB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> DC-CK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression .

text: Functional DC characteristics include fluid phase macromolecule uptake ( FITC-dextran ) and activation of resting T cells .

Comparison of KG1 to the PMA-unresponsive subline KG1a reveals differences in expression of <extra_id_0> TNF receptors 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ; <extra_id_0> PKC isoforms alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> beta I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> beta II <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> mu <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ; and <extra_id_0> RelB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , suggesting that these components / pathways are important for DC differentiation .

text: Together , these findings demonstrate that cytokine or phorbol ester stimulation of KG1 is a model of human <extra_id_0> CD34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + HPC to DC differentiation and suggest that specific intracellular signaling pathways mediate specific events in DC lineage commitment .
